sections.title: Borrowing\b\tanguag\f\bR\fsourc\fs\bfor\bD\fv\flopm\fnt\bof\bAutomatic\bSp\f\fch\b R\fcognition\bfor\b\tow-\band\bMiddl\f-D\fnsity\b\tanguag\fs\b \tyn\ftt\f\bM\flnar,\bCh\fn\b\tiu\b
paragraphs: Applicati\b\t a\td \f\bftware Research Ce\tter, M\bt\br\bla Labs M\bt\br\bla, \fchaumburg, IL 60196, U\fA Ly\tette.Mel\tar, Che\t.Liu@m\bt\br\bla.c\bm Abstract\b I\t this paper we describe a\t appr\bach that b\bth creates cr\bssli\tgual ac\bustic m\b\t\bph\b\te m\bdel sets f\br speech rec\bg\titi\b\t tasks a\td \bbjectively predicts their perf\brma\tce with\but target-la\tguage speech data \br ac\bustic measureme\tt tech\tiques. This strategy is based \b\t a series \bf li\tguistic metrics characterizi\tg the articulat\bry ph\b\tetic a\td ph\b\t\bl\bgical dista\tces \bf target-la\tguage ph\b\temes fr\bm s\burce-la\tguage ph\b\temes. We term these alg\brithms the C\bmbi\ted Ph\b\tetic a\td Ph\b\t\bl\bgical Cr\bssli\tgual Dista\tce (CPP-CD) metric a\td the C\bmbi\ted Ph\b\tetic a\td Ph\b\t\bl\bgical Cr\bssli\tgual Predicti\b\t (CPP-CP) metric. The particular m\btivati\b\ts f\br this pr\bject are the curre\tt u\tavailability a\td \bfte\t pr\bhibitively high pr\bducti\b\t c\bst \bf speech databases f\br ma\ty strategically imp\brta\tt l\bw- a\td middle-de\tsity la\tguages. First, we describe the CPP-CD appr\bach a\td c\bmpare the perf\brma\tce \bf CPP-CD-specified m\bdels t\b b\bth \tative la\tguage m\bdels a\td cr\bssli\tgual m\bdels selected by the Bhattacharyya ac\bustic-m\bdel dista\tce metric i\t aut\bmatic speech rec\bg\titi\b\t (A\fR) experime\tts. Results c\b\tfirm that the CPP-CD appr\bach \tearly matches th\bse achieved by the ac\bustic dista\tce metric. We the\t test the CPP-CP alg\brithm \b\t the CPP-CD m\bdels by c\bmpari\tg the CPP-CP sc\bres t\b the rec\bg\titi\b\t ph\b\teme err\br rates. Based \b\t this c\bmparis\b\t, we c\b\tclude that the CPP-CP alg\brithm is a reliable i\tdicat\br \bf cr\bssli\tgual m\bdel perf\brma\tce i\t speech rec\bg\titi\b\t tasks.

sections.title: 1. Introduction\b
paragraphs: \fpeech tech\t\bl\bgists typically use ac\bustic measureme\tts t\b determi\te similarity am\b\tg ac\bustic speech m\bdels f\br cr\bssli\tgual m\bdeli\tg a\td there are a variety \bf dista\tce metrics available (e.g., \f\b\bful & B\btha, 2002). Additi\b\tally, HMM similarity ca\t be evaluated i\tdirectly thr\bugh c\bmparis\b\t \bf HMM perf\brma\tces i\t A\fR experime\tts. F\br ac\bustic measureme\tts, speech data must be accessible f\br m\bdel trai\ti\tg. H\bwever, speech data u\tavailability is a practical c\b\tcer\t i\t that m\bst c\bmmercially available speech databases are pri\tcipally restricted t\b high-de\tsity la\tguages while the vast maj\brity \bf la\tguages are l\bw- a\td middle-de\tsity la\tguages. L\bw- a\td middle-de\tsity la\tguages have \t\bt bee\t exp\bsed t\b i\tte\tse data c\bllecti\b\t a\td res\burces f\br these la\tguages are subseque\ttly either limited \br c\bmpletely u\tavailable.

A high-de\tsity la\tguage is characteristically a maj\brity la\tguage ass\bciated with a large, ec\b\t\bmically adva\ttaged p\bpulati\b\t \bf speakers, a sig\tifica\tt pr\bp\brti\b\t \bf which regularly uses c\bmputers \br has c\bmputer experie\tce. The la\tguage bears \bfficial status \br \t\b\t-\bfficial pred\bmi\ta\tt use i\t \b\te \br m\bre c\bu\ttries a\td is als\b rec\bg\tized as imp\brta\tt by f\breig\t g\bver\tme\tts. Fi\tally, the la\tguage is supp\brted by a writi\tg traditi\b\t a\td has bee\t studied a\td well d\bcume\tted i\t vari\bus types \bf la\tguage res\burces. I\t regards t\b speech m\bdeli\tg, it is this last fact\br \bf la\tguage res\burce availability that pr\bves m\bst sig\tifica\tt. I\t particular, a high-de\tsity la\tguage is ass\bciated with several c\bmmercially available speech res\burces \bf vari\bus types (a\td quality). Examples \bf such high-de\tsity la\tguages are maj\br dialects \bf Arabic, E\tglish, Ma\tdari\t, a\td \fpa\tish.

A l\bw-de\tsity la\tguage, i\t c\b\ttrast, lacks ma\ty \bf the high-de\tsity characteristics. The p\bpulati\b\t \bf speakers may be quite small, ec\b\t\bmically disadva\ttaged, a\td have little \br \t\b c\bmputer experie\tce. The la\tguage may be c\b\tsidered a mi\t\brity la\tguage i\t the c\bu\ttries where it is sp\bke\t a\td is \t\bt judged t\b be very sig\tifica\tt by f\breig\t g\bver\tme\tts \br la\tguage researchers. A writi\tg system may be c\bmpletely lacki\tg f\br the l\bw-de\tsity la\tguage \br \b\tly \t\b\t-sta\tdardized writi\tg systems may exist i\t limited use; thus la\tguage res\burces are sparse \br \t\b\t-existe\tt. Ma\ty Native America\t a\td mi\t\br Africa\t la\tguages w\buld fall i\tt\b this categ\bry. Fi\tally, a middle-de\tsity la\tguage sh\bws a bala\tce \bf th\bse extremes exhibited by high- a\td l\bw-de\tsity la\tguages a\td w\buld i\tclude, f\br example, ma\ty Chi\tese, I\tdia\t, a\td Africa\t la\tguages i\t the emergi\tg market.

He\tce cr\bssli\tgual m\bdeli\tg a\td perf\brma\tce predicti\b\t that \tecessitate \t\b target-la\tguage speech data have a great value f\br the res\burce limited l\bw- a\td middle-de\tsity la\tguages by taki\tg adva\ttage \bf the well-trai\ted m\bdels \bf, typically, high-de\tsity la\tguages. Our appr\bach is specifically suited t\b target l\bw- a\td middle-de\tsity la\tguages that are (1) ass\bciated with a writi\tg system but perhaps lack sig\tifica\tt, readily available la\tguage res\burces a\td (2) related t\b \bther, typically high-de\tsity la\tguages f\br which la\tguage res\burces are easily accessible.

While this appr\bach was devel\bped with l\bw- a\td middle-de\tsity la\tguages i\t mi\td, it may als\b be a\t adequate alter\tative m\bdeli\tg strategy f\br a\ty la\tguage whe\t database acquisiti\b\t time \br expe\tse is limited.

sections.title: 225 2. Prior\bWork\b
paragraphs: The ge\teral \bbjective \bf cr\bssli\tgual m\bdeli\tg f\br A\fR is t\b create a set \bf ac\bustic m\bdels fr\bm \b\te \br m\bre s\burce la\tguages f\br a target la\tguage a\td f\br that ac\bustic m\bdel set t\b achieve adequate rec\bg\titi\b\t perf\brma\tce i\t the target la\tguage. T\b d\b this, it is ge\terally rec\bg\tized that the selected s\burce m\bdels must be similar i\t ph\b\tetic c\bverage t\b the c\brresp\b\tdi\tg target-la\tguage ph\b\temes. Thus, cr\bssli\tgual m\bdel creati\b\t a\td rec\bg\titi\b\t predicti\b\t is largely a pr\bblem i\t ph\b\teme similarity estimati\b\t.

Purely k\t\bwledge-based appr\baches t\b ph\b\teme similarity predicti\b\t ge\terally attempt t\b ide\ttify articulat\bry similarity betwee\t ph\b\temes acr\bss la\tguages. The typical strategy is subjective a\td label-based, where tw\b ph\b\temes are judged t\b be m\bre \br less similar depe\tdi\tg \b\t their tra\tscripti\b\t labels (Köhler, 1996; \fchultz & Waibel, 1997 & 2000).

I\t c\b\ttrast t\b the label-based strategy, researchers i\t such fields as dialect\bmetry, la\tguage acquisiti\b\t, a\td la\tguage rec\b\tstructi\b\t c\bmm\b\tly use aut\bmatic feature-based appr\baches t\b articulat\bry similarity betwee\t ph\b\temes. I\t these meth\bds, ph\b\temes are represe\tted by a disti\tctive feature vect\br a\td a ph\b\tetic dista\tce \br similarity alg\brithm is used t\b alig\t ph\b\teme stri\tgs betwee\t related w\brds (C\b\t\t\blly, 1997; Kessler, 1995 & 2005; K\b\tdrak, 2002; Nerb\b\t\te & Heeri\tga, 1997; \f\bmers, 1998).

I\t pri\tciple, the feature-based appr\bach admits m\bre precise specificati\b\t \bf ph\b\temes because it supp\brts all\bph\b\tic varia\tce. F\br example, a sta\tdard feature-based appr\bach t\b all\bph\b\ty represe\ttati\b\t restricts feature i\tclusi\b\t t\b \b\tly th\bse features releva\tt t\b all realizati\b\ts \bf the ph\b\teme. A\t\bther c\bmm\b\t appr\bach retai\ts features that are releva\tt t\b all all\bph\b\tic varia\tts, but leaves their values u\tderspecified (Archa\tgeli, 1988).

A strategy f\br specifyi\tg all\bph\b\ty a\td characterizi\tg ph\b\tetic dista\tce \br similarity betwee\t ph\b\temes is \b\tly \b\te c\bmp\b\te\tt i\t predicti\tg ph\b\teme similarity with\but ac\bustic data. Because ph\b\temes \tecessarily interact, it is als\b imp\brta\tt t\b c\b\tsider the ph\b\t\bl\bgy, \br at least, the ph\b\t\btactics \bf the \bverall c\b\tstructed system. Ideally, the distributi\b\t characteristics \bf the resulti\tg ac\bustic m\bdels will match the distributi\b\t characteristics \bf their c\brresp\b\tdi\tg target-la\tguage ph\b\temes.

sections.title: 3. Crosslingual\bMod\fl\bCr\fation\band\b Pr\fdiction\bM\fthod\b
paragraphs: The cr\bssli\tgual m\bdel creati\b\t a\td perf\brma\tce predicti\b\t meth\bds described here are based \b\t a c\bmbi\tati\b\t \bf metrics characterizi\tg the articulat\bry ph\b\tetic a\td ph\b\t\bl\bgical distributi\b\t dista\tces \bf ph\b\temes fr\bm s\burce a\td target la\tguages. F\br this reas\b\t, we ide\ttify the c\bllecti\b\t \bf measureme\tts a\td the appr\bach \bverall as \b\tmbine\f Ph\tnetic an\f Ph\tn\tl\tgical \br CPP (Liu & Mel\tar, 2005). The \b\tly res\burce assumed f\br each target la\tguage is a high-quality pr\b\tu\tciati\b\t dicti\b\tary.

The first step i\t the CPP appr\bach is the defi\titi\b\t \bf each s\burce a\td target la\tguage ph\b\teme by a set \bf 32 disti\tctive feature categ\bries specifically desig\ted t\b capture all\bph\b\tic variati\b\t. Next, the ph\b\tetic dista\tce betwee\t each target-la\tguage ph\b\teme a\td all s\burce-la\tguage ph\b\temes is measured. We base \bur ph\b\tetic dista\tce measureme\tt \b\t weighted articulat\bry features where the value \bf a weight f\br a feature is derived fr\bm the freque\tcy \bf the feature i\t all the s\burce-la\tguage lexica. I\t \bur experime\tts, we use the Ma\thatta\t dista\tce where the dista\tce betwee\t ph\b\temes equals the sum \bf the abs\blute values \bf i\tdividual feature dista\tces.

The ph\b\t\bl\bgical dista\tce betwee\t the s\burce a\td target la\tguages is the\t estimated by calculati\tg the lexical m\b\t\bph\b\teme a\td biph\b\teme distributi\b\t dista\tces betwee\t each s\burce la\tguage a\td the target la\tguage. F\br each la\tguage, a pr\b\tu\tciati\b\t lexic\b\t is used f\br this purp\bse. The pr\b\tu\tciati\b\t lexic\b\t a\td a ph\b\tetic descripti\b\t \bf the pr\b\tu\tciati\b\t labels used are the \b\tly la\tguage res\burces required f\br the target la\tguage i\t this appr\bach. The ph\b\tetic dista\tce, m\b\t\bph\b\teme a\td biph\b\teme ph\b\t\bl\bgical dista\tce sc\bres are the\t weighted s\b that the impact \bf ph\b\tetic dista\tce equals that \bf ph\b\t\bl\bgical dista\tce; these sc\bres are subseque\ttly c\bmbi\ted t\b ide\ttify the cl\bsest s\burce-la\tguage ph\b\teme matches f\br each target-la\tguage ph\b\teme. The pre-existi\tg ac\bustic m\bdels f\br the t\bp tw\b m\bst similar s\burce-la\tguage ph\b\temes f\br each target-la\tguage ph\b\teme are selected f\br the cr\bssli\tgual target-la\tguage m\bdel set. Because ph\b\teme similarity is based \b\t the c\bmbi\ted sc\bres \bf ph\b\tetic a\td ph\b\t\bl\bgical dista\tces, we call this metric the \bPP \br\tsslingual Distance \br CPP-CD. The CPP-CD m\bdel is schematized i\t Figure 1.             Figure 1: \fchematizati\b\t \bf the CPP-CD appr\bach
The precise f\brmulati\b\t \bf CPP-CD metric is pr\bvided i\t Liu & Mel\tar (2005) a\td is \t\bt repeated here.

We similarly predict the perf\brma\tce \bf the cr\bssli\tgual m\bdel set by measuri\tg the weighted sum \bf relative ph\b\teme dista\tces. Each target-la\tguage ph\b\teme is assig\ted a\t imp\brta\tce weight based \b\t the ph\b\teme's lexical freque\tcy. The\t the c\b\ttributi\b\t a\td i\tterfere\tce effect \bf all the \f\tn\tr ph\b\temes t\b each target-la\tguage ph\b\teme is measured. F\br each target ph\b\teme, a matching a\td c\tnfusing ph\b\teme set is  Pronunci\b\tion l\fxic\b from \bll l\bngu\bg\fs F\f\b\tur\f m\b\trix F\f\b\tur\f w\figh\ts Weighted \bh\tnetic di\ftance M\tn\t\bh\tneme di\ftance Bi\bh\tneme di\ftance C P P - C D Phon\fm\fs from \bll l\bngu\bg\fs Pronunci\b\tion l\fxic\b from \bll l\bngu\bg\fs F\f\b\tur\f m\b\trix F\f\b\tur\f w\figh\ts Weighted \bh\tnetic di\ftance M\tn\t\bh\tneme di\ftance Bi\bh\tneme di\ftance C P P - C D Phon\fm\fs from \bll l\bngu\bg\fs

defi\ted. A matchi\tg set c\b\tsists \bf the m\bst similar (i.e. least dista\tt) d\b\t\br ph\b\temes; these have a c\b\ttributi\b\t effect i\t target ph\b\teme ide\ttificati\b\t. A c\b\tfusi\tg set c\b\tsists \bf all the d\b\t\br ph\b\temes except th\bse i\t the c\brresp\b\tdi\tg matchi\tg set; because c\b\tfusi\tg ph\b\temes might have s\bme ph\b\tetic pr\bximity t\b the target ph\b\teme, they p\bte\ttially have a\t i\tterfere\tce effect i\t target ph\b\teme ide\ttificati\b\t.

\fi\tce i\tdividual ph\b\teme c\b\ttributi\b\t is represe\tted by a dista\tce measure, the t\btal c\b\ttributi\b\t is derived as a harm\b\tic sum \bf i\tdividual c\b\ttributi\b\ts. The t\btal i\tterfere\tce effect relative t\b a target ph\b\teme fr\bm a set \bf c\b\tfusi\tg ph\b\temes is derived fr\bm the dista\tce \bf each i\tdividual d\b\t\br ph\b\teme i\t the same way. The c\b\ttributi\b\t \br i\tterfere\tce effect \bf a d\b\t\br ph\b\teme t\b the target ph\b\teme is derived fr\bm the same c\bmp\b\te\tt dista\tce measures used i\t the derivati\b\t \bf CPP-CD, i.e. it c\b\tsists \bf the ph\b\tetic, m\b\t\bph\b\teme, a\td biph\b\teme dista\tce measureme\tts. We theref\bre call the predicti\b\t alg\brithm the \bPP \br\tsslingual Pre\ficti\tn \br CPP-CP. \fee Figure 2 f\br a m\bdel \bf the CPP-CP alg\brithm. Because predicti\b\t is dista\tce-based, the smaller the CPP-CP sc\bre, the higher the predicted perf\brma\tce \bf the cr\bssli\tgual m\bdels. F\br a set \bf la\tguages, we evaluate CPP-CP sc\bres relative t\b rec\bg\titi\b\t ph\b\teme err\br rates (rec\bg\titi\b\t results with the cr\bssli\tgual m\bdels \b\t the \tative speech data). The reliability \bf the predicti\b\t sc\bre is verified by its agreeme\tt with the ph\b\teme err\br rate i\t rec\bg\titi\b\t tests, as sh\bw\t i\t the \text secti\b\t.                Figure 2: \fchematizati\b\t \bf the CPP-CP appr\bach

Because the predicti\b\t sc\bre is based \b\t dista\tce, the smaller the CPP-CP sc\bre, the higher the predicted perf\brma\tce \bf the cr\bssli\tgual m\bdels. F\br a set \bf la\tguages, we evaluate CPP-CP sc\bres relative t\b rec\bg\titi\b\t ph\b\teme err\br rates (rec\bg\titi\b\t results with the cr\bssli\tgual m\bdels \b\t the \tative speech data). Where the predicti\b\t sc\bres match the ge\teral tre\td \bf the rec\bg\titi\b\t ph\b\teme err\br rates, we c\b\tsider the relative predicti\b\t sc\bres reliable.1
1 At the time \bf LREC submissi\b\t, the details \bf the CPP-CP appr\bach were u\tderg\bi\tg i\tter\tal cleara\tce review; f\br this reas\b\t, f\brmulae are \t\bt prese\tted.

I\t ge\teral, rec\bg\titi\b\t err\br is expected t\b be higher f\br th\bse la\tguages havi\tg larger biph\b\teme i\tve\tt\bries. A higher \tumber \bf biph\b\temes i\t a la\tguage c\brrelates t\b m\bre ph\b\t\btactic p\bssibilities a\td thus greater p\bte\ttial c\b\tfusability am\b\tg m\b\t\bph\b\teme m\bdels. Furtherm\bre, si\tce the CPP-CD alg\brithm is based \b\t ph\b\tetic a\td ph\b\t\bl\bgical dista\tces, it f\bll\bws that \bverall target-s\burce la\tguage pr\tximity is als\b sig\tifica\tt. Tw\b la\tguages may be said t\b be pr\bximate if they are cl\bsely related li\tguistically \br if the p\bpulati\b\ts \bf speakers i\ttermi\tgle \br \btherwise habituate c\btermi\t\bus areas (i.e. are c\b\ttact la\tguages (Trask, 1996)). A higher degree \bf ph\b\t\bl\bgical similarity is expected am\b\tg related a\td c\b\ttact la\tguages tha\t am\b\tg la\tguages that lack such pr\bximate relati\b\ts. I\t additi\b\t t\b biph\b\teme i\tve\tt\bry size a\td la\tguage pr\bximity, the quality a\td c\b\tsiste\tcy \bf the la\tguage res\burces must be c\b\tsidered imp\brta\tt perf\brma\tce fact\brs. I\t particular, \tegative perf\brma\tce fact\brs i\tclude: (1) i\tc\b\tsiste\tcy i\t data quality a\td task c\bmplexity acr\bss la\tguages due t\b database availability a\td (2) sub-\bptimal \tative m\bdel quality f\br s\bme la\tguages due t\b trai\ti\tg data i\tsufficie\tcy. I\t c\b\tducti\tg these experime\tts, we have ma\fe n\t eff\trt t\t impr\tve \tr harm\tnize the existing language res\turces; rather, \bur i\tte\tt is t\b test the CPP strategy with \bur current databases. This reflects a very practical busi\tess sce\tari\b where time is \t\bt available f\br exte\tded database pr\bcessi\tg.

sections.title: 4. Exp\frim\fnts,\bR\fsults,\band\bAnalysis\b 4.1\b CPP-CD\b
paragraphs: T\b test \bur CPP-CD appr\bach t\b m\bdeli\tg, we first c\bmpare it t\b b\bth a\t ac\bustic dista\tce appr\bach a\td t\b \tative m\b\t\bli\tgual m\bdeli\tg i\t A\fR experime\tts targeti\tg five high-de\tsity la\tguages f\br which we have speech data f\br testi\tg: Lati\t America\t \fpa\tish, Italia\t, Japa\tese, Da\tish, a\td Eur\bpea\t P\brtuguese. F\br ease \bf prese\ttati\b\t, we refer t\b each maj\br target \br s\burce dialect as a la\tguage i\t the remai\tder \bf this paper.

F\br the ac\bustic m\bdel dista\tce measureme\tt, we ad\bpt the Bhattacharyya metric (Mak & Bar\tard, 1996). The refere\tce m\bdels are built with the t\bp tw\b \tative m\bdels ch\bse\t fr\bm s\burce la\tguages based \b\t their ac\bustic dista\tce fr\bm the c\brresp\b\tdi\tg \tative target m\bdel.

F\br \tative la\tguage m\bdeli\tg, a \tative m\b\t\bli\tgual m\bdel set had bee\t built by trai\ti\tg with \tative speech data f\br each \bf the target la\tguages. The ac\bustic features are 39 regular MFCC features i\tcludi\tg cepstral, delta, a\td delta-delta. The databases i\tcluded CallH\bme, VAHA, EUROM, \fpeechDat, a\td Gl\bbalPh\b\te, am\b\tg \bthers. Because the m\bdels trai\ted with \tative la\tguage speech data are used i\t measuri\tg m\bdel dista\tce i\t the Bhattacharyya metric, it is expected t\b w\brk better tha\t \bur CPP-CD metric, which \b\tly estimates ac\bustic similarity i\tdirectly thr\bugh articulat\bry ph\b\tetic similarity a\td \bverall ph\b\t\bl\bgical
M\b\tching s\f\t Donor phon\fm\fs
Con\tr\bs\ting s\f\t
Con\tribu\tion \fff\fc\t
In\t\frf\fr\fnc\f \fff\fc\t
C P P - C P CPP-CD (F\tr target \bh\tneme #1) ... (F\tr target \bh\tneme #N) (F\tr target \bh\tneme #2) Discrimin\b\tiv\f con\tribu\tion
\fff\fc\t ... Discrimin\b\tiv\f con\tribu\tion

similarity.

F\br b\bth the CPP-CD a\td Bhattacharyya appr\baches, we use twe\tty la\tguages fr\bm six maj\br la\tguage gr\bups defi\ted by ge\tetic relati\b\t: (i) Afr\b-Asiatic: Egyptia\t Arabic; (ii) Altaic: Japa\tese, K\brea\t; (iii) Germa\tic: America\t E\tglish, British E\tglish, Da\tish, Dutch, Germa\t, \fwedish; (iv) Italic: Brazilia\t P\brtuguese, Ca\tadia\t Fre\tch, Eur\bpea\t P\brtuguese, Italia\t, Lati\t-America\t \fpa\tish, Parisia\t Fre\tch; (v) \fi\titic: Ca\tt\b\tese, Ma\tdari\t, \fha\tghai\tese; a\td (vi) \flavic: Czech, Russia\t. Am\b\tg these twe\tty la\tguages, three may be c\b\tsidered middle-de\tsity la\tguages i\t the se\tse that they are relatively u\tderreprese\tted i\t terms \bf available speech res\burces.2
These are Brazilia\t P\brtuguese, Ca\tt\b\tese, a\td \fha\tghai\tese. F\br each cr\bssli\tgual experime\tt, the target la\tguage is left \but \bf the s\burce la\tguage p\b\bl f\br m\bdel selecti\b\t.
The w\brd rec\bg\titi\b\t results \bf these experime\tts are pr\bvided i\t Table 1, al\b\tg with biph\b\teme i\tve\tt\bry sizes.

Observe that the perf\brma\tce \bf CPP-CD c\b\tstructed m\bdels \tearly matches the perf\brma\tce \bf the \tative m\bdels f\br \fpa\tish a\td surpasses th\bse f\br Italia\t. The CCP-CD appr\bach perf\brms better tha\t the Bhattacharyya ac\bustic dista\tce appr\bach f\br Italia\t, \fpa\tish, a\td Japa\tese a\td \t\bt as well f\br P\brtuguese a\td Da\tish. Overall the CPP-CD a\td Bhattacharyya ac\bustic appr\baches perf\brm similarly. The average rec\bg\titi\b\t result usi\tg the Bhattacharyya-derived m\bdels is 82.89% while the average CPP-CD result is 82.65%; thus, the differe\tce is trivial.

Target La\tguage Biph\b\t. I\tv. Native Baseli\te Ac\bustic Dista\tce CPP-CD Italia\t 613 98.42 98.27 98.52 \fpa\tish 520 94.49 88.61 93.06 Japa\tese 643 95.36 76.72 78.76 P\brtuguese 776 96.31 77.91 72.74 Da\tish 980 94.36 72.95 70.15
Table 1: M\bdel perf\brma\tce c\bmparis\b\t
(w\brd accuracy %)

As \t\bted, we expect cr\bssli\tgual m\b\t\bph\b\teme m\bdels t\b perf\brm better f\br la\tguages with fewer biph\b\temes. This expectati\b\t is validated i\t Table 1. The tw\b la\tguages with the l\bwest \tumber \bf biph\b\temes are Italia\t a\td \fpa\tish a\td their cr\bssli\tgual m\bdels have the best w\brd rec\bg\titi\b\t perf\brma\tces. The largest biph\b\teme i\tve\tt\bry bel\b\tgs t\b Da\tish, a\td b\bth Da\tish cr\bssli\tgual m\bdel sets have the w\brst perf\brma\tce results. F\br Japa\tese a\td P\brtuguese, the relative perf\brma\tce differs usi\tg the tw\b dista\tce metrics.  2 We c\b\tsulted the speech res\burce catal\bgues \bf the Li\tguistic Data C\b\ts\brtium (LDC), Eur\bpea\t La\tguage Res\burces Ass\bciati\b\t (ELRA), a\td Appe\t Ltd. t\b i\tf\brmally evaluate speech database availability. F\br b\bth \fha\tghai\tese a\td Ca\tt\b\tese \b\tly \b\te speech database is available, while Brazilia\t P\brtuguese is ass\bciated with three speech databases. P\brtuguese has the third best perf\brma\tce a\td Japa\tese, the f\burth, usi\tg the Bhattacharyya meth\bd, while these la\tguages are swapped i\t perf\brma\tce ra\tk usi\tg the CPP-CD appr\bach.

Three \bf the five test la\tguages bel\b\tg t\b the Italic bra\tch \bf the I\td\b-Eur\bpea\t la\tguage family (\fpa\tish, Italia\t, a\td P\brtuguese), a\td there are a t\btal \bf six Italic s\burce la\tguages. This leaves five Italic s\burce la\tguages f\br each \bf the three Italic test la\tguages. The test la\tguages i\tclude \b\te Germa\tic la\tguage (Da\tish); this la\tguage is als\b ass\bciated with five cl\bsely related la\tguages. Besides these cl\bse i\tter-gr\bup relati\b\tships, Germa\tic a\td Italic la\tguages are dista\ttly related t\b each \bther a\td have a l\b\tg hist\bry \bf cl\bse c\b\ttact. I\t c\b\ttrast with this, Japa\tese is \b\tly related t\b \b\te s\burce la\tguage, K\brea\t, th\bugh d\bes have a l\b\tg hist\bry \bf c\b\ttact with the \fi\titic la\tguages.

Based s\blely \b\t la\tguage pr\bximity, we w\buld predict the Italic a\td Germa\tic la\tguages t\b perf\brm the best. \fpa\tish a\td Italia\t d\b c\b\tf\brm t\b this expectati\b\t, while Da\tish a\td P\brtuguese d\b \t\bt. Ab\bve, Da\tish's cr\bssli\tgual m\bdel perf\brma\tce is c\brrelated with Da\tish's large biph\b\teme i\tve\tt\bry size. We \bbserve here that P\brtuguese has the sec\b\td highest \tumber \bf biph\b\temes a\td suggest that this might likewise acc\bu\tt f\br the relatively l\bw cr\bssli\tgual m\bdel perf\brma\tces.

I\t c\b\tclusi\b\t, the CPP-CD cr\bssli\tgual perf\brma\tce results are c\bmparable t\b th\bse derived fr\bm the ac\bustic m\bdel dista\tce measureme\tt a\td c\b\tf\brm t\b expectati\b\ts based \b\t the k\t\bw\t perf\brma\tce fact\brs \bf biph\b\teme i\tve\tt\bry size a\td la\tguage pr\bximity.

sections.title: 4.1\b CPP-CP\b
paragraphs: We \t\bw use the CPP-CP alg\brithm t\b ge\terate predicti\b\t
sc\bres f\br each \bf the five test la\tguages. Recall that
ph\b\teme err\br perce\ttage is the ph\b\teme rec\bg\titi\b\t
result usi\tg the CPP-CD-derived m\bdels \b\t the \tative
speech data. If the tre\td \bf the predicti\b\t sc\bres matches
the tre\td \bf the ph\b\teme err\br rates, we c\b\tsider the
relative predicti\b\t sc\bres reliable.                Figure 3: C\bmparis\b\t \bf ph\b\teme err\br rates a\td
CPP-CP sc\bres (1)

40 45 50 55 60 65 70 Sp\bnish I\t\bli\bn J\bp\bn\fs\f Por\tugu\fs\f D\bnish P h  E \b \b \t \b  ( % \f 0.5 0.7 0.9 1.1 1.3 1.5 1.7 1.9 P \b e d i c t i \t n  S c \t \b e Ph Error (%) Pr\fdic\tion Scor\f Lin\f\br (Ph Error (%)) Lin\f\br (Pr\fdic\tion Scor\f)

Figure 3 c\b\tfirms that the tre\td \bf the CPP-CP sc\bres d\bes match that \bf the ph\b\teme err\br rates, a\td, based \b\t these results, we may te\ttatively c\b\tclude that these CPP-CP sc\bres are i\tdicative \bf actual rec\bg\titi\b\t perf\brma\tce. The results prese\tted i\t Figure 3 furtherm\bre suggest that target-la\tguage cr\bssli\tgual m\bdel sets that have a CPP-CP sc\bre \bf less tha\t 1 are likely t\b achieve acceptable rec\bg\titi\b\t perf\brma\tce levels (\fpa\tish, Italia\t, a\td Japa\tese CPP-CP m\bdels average a w\brd accuracy \bf 90.11%).

Testi\tg with additi\b\tal, l\bwer-de\tsity target la\tguages substa\ttiates this judgme\tt. I\t a sec\b\td experime\tt, we create CPP-CD-derived m\bdels f\br the three ide\ttified middle-de\tsity la\tguages, Brazilia\t P\brtuguese, Ca\tt\b\tese, a\td \fha\tghai\tese. We use the same twe\tty s\burce la\tguages selected f\br the first experime\tt a\td likewise c\bmpare their cr\bssli\tgual ph\b\teme err\br rates a\td CPP-CP sc\bres.
C\b\tsider \t\bw i\t Table 2 the biph\b\teme i\tve\tt\bry size a\td \tumber \bf cl\bsely related la\tguages c\brresp\b\tdi\tg t\b each \bf the eight test la\tguages.3

Brazilia\t P\brtuguese is a\t\bther Italic la\tguage a\td thus is cl\bsely related t\b five \bf the remai\ti\tg \ti\tetee\t s\burce la\tguages. Like Eur\bpea\t P\brtuguese, the Brazilia\t P\brtuguese biph\b\teme i\tve\tt\bry is large; i\t fact, with 1046 biph\b\temes, Brazilia\t P\brtuguese has the largest test la\tguage biph\b\teme i\tve\tt\bry.

La\tguages Average 665.75 4.125 Ca\tt\b\tese 320 2 \fha\tghai\tese 428 2 Spanish\b 520\b 5\b Italian\b 613\b 5\b Japa\tese 643 1 Eur. P\brtuguese 776 5 Da\tish 980 5 Br. P\brtuguese 1046 5
Table 2: C\bmparis\b\t \bf perf\brma\tce fact\brs
am\b\tg the eight test la\tguages

Ca\tt\b\tese a\td \fha\tghai\tese are b\bth \fi\titic la\tguages; besides bei\tg cl\bsely related t\b each \bther, they are als\b ge\tetically related t\b Ma\tdari\t. Their biph\b\teme i\tve\tt\bries are the smallest with 320 a\td 428 biph\b\temes respectively.
If we h\bld average values as a relative i\tdicati\b\t \bf perf\brma\tce, we see that am\b\tg the eight la\tguages, \b\tly tw\b, Italia\t a\td \fpa\tish are ab\bve average f\br b\bth fact\brs.

Figure 4 pr\bvides the ph\b\te err\br rates a\td predicti\b\t sc\bres f\br the c\bmplete set \bf test la\tguages. As i\t Figure 3, we see that the tre\tds \bf the CPP-CP sc\bres a\td ph\b\te err\br perce\ttages c\brresp\b\td. Am\b\tg the middle-de\tsity  3 O\tly relate\f la\tguage i\tf\brmati\b\t is pr\bvided here. Establishi\tg releva\tt c\b\ttact la\tguage status is bey\b\td the sc\bpe \bf this study. la\tguages, \b\tly Ca\tt\b\tese has a predicti\b\t sc\bre bel\bw 1, i\tdicati\tg that its cr\bssli\tgual m\bdel set is expected t\b achieve a practical use rec\bg\titi\b\t level. We suggest that the very small biph\b\teme i\tve\tt\bry size \bf Ca\tt\b\tese c\b\ttributes t\b this relatively l\bw predicti\b\t sc\bre.
Figure 4: C\bmparis\b\t \bf ph\b\teme err\br rates a\td
CPP-CP sc\bres (2)

We \t\bte that the \fha\tghai\tese cr\bssli\tgual m\bdels perf\brm less well tha\t predicted relative t\b the \bther la\tguages. This is surprisi\tg give\t that the \fha\tghai\tese biph\b\teme i\tve\tt\bry size is very small a\td the \tumber a\td ge\tetic type \bf related la\tguages are the same as th\bse \bf Ca\tt\b\tese. H\bwever, the \fha\tghai\tese database has \t\bt bee\t subject t\b validati\b\t that w\buld c\b\tfirm its \bverall quality a\td c\b\tsiste\tcy. We theref\bre admit the p\bssibility that the p\b\br \fha\tghai\tese cr\bssli\tgual m\bdel perf\brma\tce is attributable t\b substa\tdard \tative-la\tguage res\burces.

sections.title: 5. Conclusion\b
paragraphs: The experime\tts prese\tted herei\t dem\b\tstrate that the CPP strategy is a\t effective meth\bd f\br b\bth selecti\tg m\b\t\bph\b\te m\bdels f\br cr\bssli\tgual rec\bg\titi\b\t a\td predicti\tg the rec\bg\titi\b\t perf\brma\tce \bf the derived m\bdel sets. Because the CPP appr\bach requires \t\b target-la\tguage ac\bustic data, it is especially useful f\br creati\tg a\td validati\tg cr\bssli\tgual m\bdel sets f\br target la\tguages lacki\tg speech data res\burces, such as l\bw- a\td middle-de\tsity la\tguages. As ma\ty emergi\tg markets are p\bpulated by l\bw- a\td middle-de\tsity la\tguage speakers, this t\b\bl ca\t be \bf great assista\tce i\t e\tteri\tg a market quickly a\td c\bst-effectively.
